qas.question: How many major papers are published?
What is the 3rd oldest paper in the nation?
Who owns the major papers in the city?

context: Philadelphia's <a0_0>two<a0_0/> major daily newspapers are The <a1_0>Philadelphia Inquirer<a1_0/>, which is the eighteenth largest newspaper and third-oldest surviving daily newspaper in the country, and the Philadelphia Daily News. Both newspapers were purchased from The McClatchy Company (after buying out Knight Ridder) in 2006 by Philadelphia Media Holdings and operated by the group until the organization declared bankruptcy in 2010. After two years of financial struggle, the two newspapers were sold to <a2_0>Interstate General Media<a2_0/> in 2012. The two newspapers have a combined circulation of about 500,000 readers.
